Package com.rb.nonbiz.functional

    AllowsMissingValues<V>
    Sometimes we use Optional inside a data class to denote a missing value.
    AllowsMissingValues.Visitor<T,​V>

    Java 8 only defines up to BiFunction.

  • Class Summary
    Class Description
    AdditionSubtractionAndIdentityElement<T>
    An addition function (which, in general, may apply to non-scalars, such as TotalByPortfolioType), a subtraction function, and an identity element.
    GeometricCollaredRBNumericFunctionBuilder<X extends java.lang.Number,​Y extends RBNumeric<? super Y>>
    This lets us build a function with a collar on its Y values (min + max) in a slightly more legible fashion.
    LinearCollaredRBNumericFunctionBuilder<X extends java.lang.Number,​Y extends RBNumeric<? super Y>>
    This lets us build a linear function with a collar on its Y values (min + max) in a slightly more legible fashion.
    N_aryFunction<X,​Y>
    A function f(x1, x2, ..., xN) where the x_i are all of the same type, but f() doesn't have to return a value of the same type as the x_i.
    N_aryOperator<T>
    An operator f(x1, x2, ..., xN) where the x_i are all of the same type, as is f().
    NPlusOneAryFunction<X,​Y>
    A descriptor for a function f( {x1, x2, ..., xN}, xx) where the x_i and xx are all of the same type, but f doesn't have to return a value of the same type as the x_i.
    NPlusOneAryPredicate<X>
    A descriptor for a predicate f( {x1, x2, ..., xN}, xx) where the x_i and xx are of the same type, and f is a boolean.
    RBBiPredicates
    Various binary predicates in the form of static methods.
    RBNumericFunction<X extends java.lang.Number,​Y extends RBNumeric<? super Y>>
    This is a special class that lets us declare a (mathematical) function that maps a Number (currently - Mar 2024 - we only care about Long or Double) to another RBNumeric.
    RBNumericFunctionThatHandlesMissingValues<X extends java.lang.Number,​Y extends RBNumeric<? super Y>>
    A data class representing a (mathematical) function from Number (Double or Long currently - Mar 2024), where it's also possible to have a 'missing' X.
    RBPredicates
    Various unary comparison predicates.
    RBStringToNumericFunctionThatHandlesMissingValues<Y extends RBNumeric<? super Y>>
    A function that maps a string to an RBNumeric, and either also allows a 'missing string' case (which maps to a constant RBNumeric), or returns empty if a missing string is encountered.
    RBStringToNumericFunctionThatHandlesMissingValues.RBStringToNumericFunctionThatHandlesMissingValuesBuilder<Y extends RBNumeric<? super Y>>  
    SimpleStepFunctionRBNumericFunctionBuilder<X extends java.lang.Number,​Y extends RBNumeric<? super Y>>
    This lets you build a simple step function with one y-value Y0 below a specified X0, and another value Y1 at X0 or above: y = y0 for x < x0.
    UnitFractionFunction<Y extends RBNumeric<? super Y>>
    A Function from UnitFraction to any arbitrary RBNumeric type.
